page.title: 14DANBURY PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Church is named after John the Baptist.As you enter the Church from the main door you will see some steps these lead up to the bell tower.In the bell tower there are 8 bells they were refounded in 1967.Underneath the bell tower there are several memorial tablets.The oldest of alabster commemorates an Elizabethen Rector.In the north aisle there are three oak effiges these are of the St Cleres family who built the Church.The oldest part of the Church is the north arcade this dates from the 13th century.The Church is the highest point in Essex. The Vestry dates from the 15th century.A fire place was uncovered after the bomb hit the Church during the Second World War.At the opposite end of the Church to the main entrance there is a drain pipe this has got the date of when the Church was rebuilt.
